description.narrative: Output 2.2: 80% health facilities are able to provide comprehensive Paediatric ART services., which contributes to Care And Treatment Of Children Affected By Hiv And Aids, Treatment And Care Of Children Living With Hiv. UNICEF aims to achieve this through Systems Strengthening And Institution Building. This contributes to the following Country Programme result: Outcome 02: Improved and equitable use of proven HIV prevention and treatment interventions by children, pregnant women and adolescents (boys & girls), by 2015.

participating-org.narrative: MINISTRY OF FINANCE AND ECONOMIC DEVELOPMENT

title.narrative: Description of UNICEF programming approach framework at the country level with Common Country Assessments (CCAs) providing the equivalence of pre project appraisals

condition.narrative: Should contribute directly to results for children as outlined in the UNDAF, national results and/or UNICEF Strategic Plan and within the scope defined in the CPD, CPAP, OMP or other agreed upon programme documents

title.narrative: Output 2.2: 80% health facilities are able to provide comprehensive Paediatric ART services.
Proportion of health facilities that are providing comprehensive Paediatric ART services.

Proportion of secondary health facilities with functional IMNCI services that have at least one health professional with Paediatric HIV management skills, & are fully equipped and supplied & regularly monitored to provide these services by 2015.
Proportion of health facilities maintaining at least 80% availability Paed-ART drugs.
